messages.subject: Re: [samuraihistory] Modern Day Sword Training?
messages.msgSnippet: I think Tom Cruise is full of shit.. the sword fighting in that mvoie was all hollywood bull crap..  try looking for someone who teaches Iaido as well as
messages.messageBody:
I think Tom Cruise is full of shit.. the sword fighting in that mvoie was all hollywood bull crap.. try looking for someone who teaches Iaido as well as kendo..

Wilson


--

--------- Original Message ---------
DATE: Sun, 11 Jan 2004 02:30:45
From: BMCAMP@...
To: samuraihistory@yahoogroups.com
Cc:

Hello to all,

I am new to the group, but find the Samurai interesting and am reading
everything I can. My question has to do with modern studies of the Samurai
techniques of swordmanship. I have seen a few books about it, and even heard that Tom
Cruise studied with a group out of New York City. I would like to know where
I could possibly learn the techniques learned by the Samurai. I have not
seen any Kendo teachers in my area.

Thanks,

Brett


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Re: [samuraihistory] Modern Day Sword Training?
messages.msgSnippet: There are Kendo groups in various parts of the country, (none near me), but depending upon where you are there may be some. Be prepared to spend several
messages.messageBody:
There are Kendo groups in various parts of the country, (none near me), but depending upon where you are there may be some. Be prepared to spend several hundred dollars on equipment and lessons. A simple web search for 'Kendo' should find you a few sites that have links to dojos around the country.

BMCAMP@... wrote:Hello to all,
